result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin D. Jordan

defendant.name: Jordan, Austin D.
defendant.address: E4937 County Road V, La Valle, WI 53941

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on January 6, 2023 at 08:45 am.

10:31 AM Defendant Austin D. Jordan in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Edward Covey in court for Austin D. Jordan.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes through previous plea.  Joint stipulation to modify bond and stipulation on a DPA.  State agrees stipulation reached and victim notification met.  Oral statements to be given today.  Mother of victim  will make statement and Hope House advocate will be reading statement.  Attorney Covey.  Amend Count 3 to 940.225(3)(m).  Plea to Count 2 & amended Count 3.  Dismiss/read in other counts.  Count 2: DPA 5 years w/ conditions.  Count 3:  9 months jail with work release.  228 days credit.  $443.00 costs and DNA sample.  Bond modification today if DPA accepted per the stipulation.  Attorney Covey states age of defendant's child.  Court accepts amended charge.  Attorney Covey enters NC plea to Count 3 as amended.  Defendant enters NC plea to Count 2.  Recess to go through GPA again today.  Recess at 1039 a.m.  Back on the record at 1045 a.m.  Document 27 printed and reviewed again by Defendant.  State gives status on family members and other peoples thoughts on recommendation.  Court goes through plea and defendant's rights.  GPA reviewed and signed again today between defendant and Attorney Covey.  Attorney Covey agrees his client understands plea and penalties.   Court approves waivers.  Withholds ruling on Count 2 until further argument given.  Adj. guilty on Count 3. R.J., mother, statement to the court.  Danielle Pinckney, Hope House advocate, reads written statement by K.J., victim.  State gives sentencing argument at 1114 a.m.  Defendant was a juvenile at the time of the offense.  Request Court follow stipulation reached.  Attorney Covey agrees with State on agreement reached.  Attorney Covey makes final sentencing statement.  Also request the Court accept the DPA, recommendation and bond stipulation.  Defendant makes no statement. Court goes through history of case and documents filed.  Court cannot grant the DPA as written.  Recess at 1132 a.m.  Back on the record at 1146 a.m.  Attorney Covey request delay in sentencing.  Not withdrawing the plea today.  Will be requesting records from Winnebago.  Defendant request bond be modified pending the reports to be completed.  State signed the stipulation on bond.  Pleas have been entered today.  State does not object to bond stipulation.  Telephone status to be set 60 days out.  Counsel may file motion to modify bond if they choose.  Court denies bond stipulation today.  Notice of hearing to be mailed.

ADDRESS INFO for Austin D. Jordan

Prior: 910 Lake St, Apt 501, Baraboo, WI 53913
Atty Covey acknowledges rec. information, waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Covey stands mute.  Court enters not guilty plea(s) - set for plea/sent.  Bond continued.

DE understands the need to reset the matter and bond will continue.  Court grants the request.  Matter will be set for TSC in 30 days.

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Austin D. Jordan in court, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Austin D. Jordan.  Atty Getsinger requests a preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:32 AM Defendant Austin D. Jordan in court with attorney Annie E Getsinger.  Defendant Austin D. Jordan in custody.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Getsinger recommends $500 cash bond or a signature bond.  State objects. Victim's mom makes statement.  Court amends bond to $3,000 CASH.  No contact with DE's 2 siblings with DOB's of 2-9-12 and 4-10-07.  No contact with the DE's mother, R.J.  No contact with anyone under 18, unless incidental within the community and will be subject to GPS.  May not be within 150 feet of RJ or her residence.  May not be within 500 feet of the DE's child, or within 500 feet of the DE's child's residence or where the child is receiving childcare.
Motion hearing on May 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date on May 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:03 AM Defendant Austin D. Jordan in court with attorney Annie E Getsinger.  Defendant Austin D. Jordan in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds waiver to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Public Defender appointment
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:57 PM Defendant Austin D. Jordan by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Kathryn E Hayes by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Austin D. Jordan in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for public defender representation.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Hayes recommends no more than $500 cash bond.   $5,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with DE's 2 siblings with DOB's of 2-9-12 and 4-10-07.  No contact with the DE's mother, R.J.  No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 and must supervised by another adult unless incidental of being out in the community.  May not leave the State of WI without prior permission of the Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
